entry.title: Combined summary - Useful bitcoin patches...
entry.summary: The Bitcoin developers are discussing various features and fixes that could be added to the platform. Some of these include multithreading the RPC, adding HTTP/1.1 keep-alive support, and a fix from Luke Dash Jr. There is also discussion around hub mode, which some believe would generate too much network usage on other nodes, and accepting lower fees. However, there is concern that accepting lower fees without a carefully thought-out solution could lead to problems and that developers should not get in the way between users and pools willing to do business. Overall, the focus is on making sure any new features or changes are thoroughly tested and will not cause issues for users.
